1.brief: gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
to snatch away, whether in a good or a bad sense
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to hurry; figuratively, to be eager with excitement or enjoyment

2.brief: properly, to pale, i.e. by implication to be ashamed; also (by implication) to be disappointed or delayed
to blush; figuratively, to be ashamed, disappointed; causatively, to shame, reproach
to search out (by any method, specifically in worship or prayer); by implication, to strive after
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
properly, to flinch, i.e. (by implication) to go back, literally (to retreat) or figuratively (to apostatize)
the hinder part; hence (adverb) behind, backward; also (as facing north) the West
properly, to wound; but only figuratively, to taunt or insult
bad or (as noun) evil (natural or moral)

3.brief: to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a heel, i.e. (figuratively) the last of anything (used adverbially, for ever); also result, i.e. compensation; and so (adverb with preposition or relatively) on account of
shame (the feeling and the condition, as well as its cause); by implication (specifically) an idol

4.brief: probably to brighten up, i.e. (figuratively) be (causatively, make) blithe or gleesome
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
to search out (by any method, specifically in worship or prayer); by implication, to strive after
properly, continuance (as indefinite extension); but used only (attributively as adjective) constant (or adverbially, constantly); ellipt. the regular (daily) sacrifice
to be (causatively make) large (in various senses, as in body, mind, estate or honor, also in pride)

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
to have affection for (sexually or otherwise)
something saved, i.e. (abstractly) deliverance; hence, aid, victory, prosperity

5.brief: gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
to hurry; figuratively, to be eager with excitement or enjoyment
to slip out, i.e. escape; causatively, to deliver
thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
to loiter (i.e. be behind); by implication to procrastinate

6.brief: gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
to hurry; figuratively, to be eager with excitement or enjoyment
to slip out, i.e. escape; causatively, to deliver
thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
to loiter (i.e. be behind); by implication to procrastinate
